Rule: Individuals who are "Married" are more likely to earn more than $50,000 a year.
Working more hours per week increases the likelihood of earning more than $50,000 a year.
Being "Male" may increase the likelihood of earning more than $50,000 a year.
Older individuals may have a higher likelihood of earning more than $50,000 a year.
Higher education (Doctorate) leads to higher income.
Variation in workclass (from Private to Other/Unknown) may lead to higher income.
